awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase II:  Evaluative Artificial Speech Intelligence and Autism Screener (EASI-AS)
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project will improve treatment for children with communication impairments. The project will develop a system that provides specialists and parents with reports that have accurate, efficient, and easy-to-understand speech and language evaluations with recommendations and suggestions, for better understanding the children’s communication challenges and how to solve them. It will bridge the gap between a clinical assessment and support at home, impacting clinical outcomes by providing a more accurate assessment of child language developmental needs. Consequently, this will result in more personalized education and treatment, particularly for diverse communities.  

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project addresses pain points surrounding speech and language assessment with children with communication impairments. The child’s language use must be captured in a natural setting to obtain an accurate analysis. The solution is a flexible, self-customizing system using a trained AI approach to evaluate speech and language skills, then provide analytical feedback in key communication areas. To evaluate a child’s communication skills, the system collects a language sample based on natural adult-child social language interactions. Research objectives include: (1) improvement and development of machine-learning modules, specifically the language proficiency assessment, recommendation engine, recognition of child voices, recognition of accents and dialects, and intonation detection; (2) an autism screener development, to be used as a pre-diagnostic tool with eye-tracking technology; and (3) web and mobile application development for data collection by the child.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
EASI-AS: Enhancing Autism Screening and Speech-Language Assessment with AI Technology

 The Evaluative Artificial Speech Intelligence Autism Screener (EASI-AS) is an innovative AI-driven platform developed to streamline the early detection of autism and enhance speech-language assessments. Supported by the National Science Foundation, EASI-AS leverages cutting-edge technology to reduce the time and effort required for assessments while enhancing their accuracy and utility. Through automated processes and real-time clinician support, EASI-AS aims to make autism screening more accessible, efficient, and effective.

 Project Goals and Intellectual Merit

 EASI-AS was developed to address key challenges faced by clinicians in assessing autism and speech-language delays. Traditional assessments can be time-consuming, requiring significant manual effort for scoring, data entry, and analysis. By integrating AI and computer vision, EASI-AS automates these tasks, enabling clinicians to focus on patient care while maintaining high standards of accuracy. The project’s primary objectives included:

 - Automating Scoring and Reporting: EASI-AS utilizes AI to automatically score assessments, minimizing human error and enhancing efficiency.

- Real-Time Support: Conversational AI provides clinicians with on-the-spot guidance, ensuring consistency in test administration.

- Data Security and Compliance: EASI-AS adheres to HIPAA and FERPA standards, ensuring patient data is securely stored and managed.

 These advancements contribute to the broader field of speech-language pathology by demonstrating the potential of AI to streamline and improve diagnostic assessments.

  Broader Impacts

 EASI-AS’s innovations extend beyond the clinical setting to address a broader societal need for early and accessible autism screening. Early identification and intervention for autism can significantly improve long-term developmental outcomes, particularly in communication and social skills. The EASI-AS platform provides a scalable solution that can be implemented across various environments, including schools, clinics, and teletherapy, increasing accessibility for families who may face geographic or economic barriers to autism assessments.

 Key benefits of the EASI-AS project include:

 - Improved Accessibility: EASI-AS enables more consistent, widely available screenings, particularly in underserved areas.

- Reduction in Administrative Burden: By automating time-intensive tasks, EASI-AS allows clinicians to allocate more time to patient interactions and intervention planning.

- Supporting Caregivers and Educators: The platform’s reports offer actionable insights that caregivers and educators can easily understand, promoting a more holistic approach to support.

  Project Outcomes

 Since its inception, EASI-AS has demonstrated remarkable potential in both research and practical application:

1. Enhanced Diagnostic Capabilities: EASI-AS offers a unique approach to analyzing language samples by integrating metrics such as vocabulary diversity and social function analysis. These insights are crucial for personalized intervention planning and early diagnosis.

2. Reduction in Evaluation Time: Traditional assessments often take hours to administer and score. With EASI-AS, these processes can be completed in minutes, removing a significant barrier to timely diagnosis and reducing clinician burnout.

3. Broad Clinical Adoption: Following successful trials and positive reception from clinicians, EASI-AS has gained traction within the speech-language pathology community and has been featured in the ASHA Leader, reaching over 225,000 professionals.

 Through continuous AI enhancement and real-world validation, EASI-AS has shown that advanced technology can be responsibly and effectively integrated into clinical settings, enhancing both the scope and quality of autism screening.

  Looking Forward

 The success of EASI-AS highlights the importance of continued investment in AI technologies for healthcare. Future developments aim to integrate additional features, such as augmented reality tools and personalized data collection, to further refine assessments and expand the system’s diagnostic capabilities. As EASI-AS continues to grow, it holds promise not only as a diagnostic tool but also as a catalyst for a more inclusive, accessible approach to autism screening and language development support.

 This project has made significant strides toward reshaping the landscape of autism and speech-language assessment, providing clinicians with powerful, user-friendly tools and promoting timely interventions for families and children across the country.

 

 

 

 


Last Modified: 11/07/2024
Modified by: Lois J Brady
